avalancheActivity.comment:
Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions. Avalanches can be released in the old snowpack, in particular by large additional loads.

The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack is largely stable and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. In particular shady slopes high altitudes and the high Alpine regions: Towards its surface, the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.

tendency.comment: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall over a wide area. Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The snowpack will be generally well bonded. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.

In very isolated cases weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow profiles and stability tests have shown the favourable bonding of the snowpack.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack is favourably layered and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. Field observations have indicated good snowpack stability.

tendency.comment: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall over a wide area. Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.
